intro: Selinum humile, commonly known as the lesser calamity, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Selinum humile is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued in herbal medicine for its potential medicinal properties, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family.
